article.headline: Big Tech shares drop amid reports House subcommittee wants to split them up
article.body: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +3.01%, Google parent Alphabet Inc. GOOGL, +1.82% [GOOG], Facebook Inc. FB, +0.26%, and Apple Inc. AAPL, +1.74% were down Tuesday amid reports that a House subcommittee that has investigated anticompetitive business practices for more than a year is set to recommend splitting them up and limiting the scope of their future acquisitions. For more on the report, click here. Amazon's stock so far has taken the biggest hit, dropping 2.6%. Apple was down 2.2%, while Google slid 1.7%, and Facebook declined 1.5%. The subcommittee's report making those recommendations is expected any day.
